page.title: 18HISTORICAL HEAGE.
page.content: St LUKES -Thriving Anglican church. 17th Century stone T-shaped building with beautiful stained glass windows. Seats 300. 1343 Nicholas of High Edge-the priest. 1545 Destroyed by Gale. 1661 Rebuilt by George Pole-Heage Hall 1855-1974 Three Rectors served here. 1975 New appointment-priest in charge. A flock of Jacobs sheep is kept in the church yard to eat the grass. HEAGE HALL-16th Century private house. Hidden from view in the Dumbles,Nether Heage.Home of the Pole Family who were Lords of the Manor.George rebuilt the church as retribution for his misdeeds .Ledgends of Ghostly haunting near the Hall. WINDMILL-Last turned in 1919.Exterior restored by Derbyshire County Council. Fine example of a six-sail Tower Mill. It stands on Dungely Hill.
